snippet: Prime Minister Lucas Papademos and leaders in his government pledged to resume talks to reach an agreement on measures required for a bailout.
abstract: Prime Minister Lucas Papademos and leaders in his government pledge to resume talks to reach an agreement on austerity measures demanded by Greece’s financial backers in return for a $170 billion bailout; if the leaders do not accept the measures, Greece’s foreign lenders will not give it the aid it needs to prevent a default as soon as March; it would also jeopardize a bond swap under which private investors would take losses of up to 70 percent.

byline.original: By RACHEL DONADIO and NIKI KITSANTONIS
byline.contributor: Landon Thomas Jr. contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Lucas Papademos and leaders in his government pledged to resume talks to reach an agreement on measures required for a bailout.

headline.seo: Austerity Measure Talks Are Stalled in Greece
headline.main: Talks on Austerity Steps Are Stalled in Greece
headline.print_headline: Talks on Austerity Steps Are Stalled in Greece
